comments:
I'm using TPTP 4.1.0.1 with Eclipse SDK 3.1.2. When I launch profiling from Java perspective I got the following error:
"Launch mode profile not supported for configuration type org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.ExternalLaunchConfigurationType".

If I put "-XrunpiAgent:server=enabled" in VM arguments the error is:
"An internal error ocurred during: Launching" with the following trace
 
"java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.internal.xml.Resolver.skipToProperty(Resolver.java:108)
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.internal.xml.Resolver.resolvePropertiesFromCache(Resolver.java:95)
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.internal.xml.Resolver.resolveProperties(Resolver.java:66)
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.GenericServerBehaviour.getStartClassName(GenericServerBehaviour.java:252)
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.GenericServerLaunchConfigurationDelegate.launch(GenericServerLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:57)
at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.profile.server.wst.internal.generic.GenericServerDelegate.launch(GenericServerDelegate.java:30)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:590)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:515)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:733)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:931)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)"



If I try it from Server view, when I select the Bea Weblogic Server, the option "Profile" appears disabled.

I have probed it using 8.1 and 9.0 versions of Bea Weblogic Server.

Regards.

This problem is reproducible in run mode with WTP1.5(Eclipse 3.2), BEA WebLogic 9.2 and JDK1.5

A more updated stack trace:
An internal error occurred during: "Launching".
java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.internal.xml.Resolver.skipToProperty(Resolver.java:117)
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.internal.xml.Resolver.resolvePropertiesFromCache(Resolver.java:104)
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.internal.xml.Resolver.resolveProperties(Resolver.java:82)
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.GenericServerBehaviour.getStartClassName(GenericServerBehaviour.java:256)
at 
org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.GenericServerLaunchConfigurationDelegate.launch(GenericServerLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:60)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:639)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:565)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:754)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:944)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

Also profile action (context menu and toolbar action) of this server type is not enabled with the contribution of org.eclipse.jst.server.core.serverProfilers from TPTP.

WLS uses an external launch, meaning it calls an external script to run the server, and this is does not support profiling. So the error "Launch mode profile not supported for configuration type org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.ExternalLaunchConfigurationType" is accurate.
assigning to Rob for further comments.

right; the generic WLS server adapters launch the server via an external script (the user specified startWebLogic.* script); my understanding of TPTP/JVMPI is not sufficient to know whether it may be possible to support TPTP profiling for external generic servers (i.e. pass in VM args so that the remote JVM is executed with the necessary jvmpi agent enabled and get the TPTP logic in Eclipse to communicate with it); I'll leave this open to investigate but will mark as an enhancement as this functionality is not currently supported.
The WLS adapters have been removed from WTP 2.0 and are available from BEA via a remote download site so I'm closing out this bug.
